pilotboy_84 wrote:
> I have a question mark. 
> I make a crawl with a determined number of seeds and the crawl is
> stopped by some reason. How can i continue the crawl where i left,
> without repeat the same crawled URIs?
> Please, if someone can help me. Is very important to me.

If you were previously using crawl checkpoints, you can resume 
from the point of the checkpoint. (Only the URIs from that point 
on will be repeated.)

If not, you can use the recovery-log method, which attempts to 
rebuild the state of the already-seen URIs and all pending queues 
by replaying a compressed recovery journal the crawler usually 
writes to the logs directory. Usually only a small number of URIs 
will be revisited in this case -- those that hadn't been cleanly 
flushed to the compressed log at the time of the first crawl end.

See this section of the Heritrix 1.x User Manual:

http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/outside.html#recover

The general process in Heritrix2 is the same, though some of the 
settings and UI for setting up and resuming from checkpoints has 
changed slightly.

- Gordon @ IA
